title.narrative: 3. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) - ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector stakeholders are equipped with an enabling environment for better planning, budgeting, implementing and monitoring of interventions., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Environmental Sustainability, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, WASH sector stakeholders are equipped with an enabling environment for better planning, budgeting, implementing andmonitoring of interventions.

description.narrative: In 2021, UNICEF Burkina Faso contributed to reinforcement of theHumanitarian-Development-Peace (HPD) Nexus, through sector dialogue and development of roadmap for its institutionalisation process, in close coordination with the Ministry of Water and Sanitation (MEA). Additionally, the country office (CO)played a key advocacy role in improving strategies as well as obtaining Government commitment to mobilize financial resources to ensure the sustainability of infrastructures. In term of evidence generation, ;the CO supported several initiatives, including research action on Sanitation and Climate Change, Inventory of WASH in Schools as well support to the MEA’sSector Knowledge and Learning Management Plan (GCAS). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/01/2022
